title: Sum of Two Numbers
code:
# This program calculates the sum of two numbers and prints the result
a = 1 # First number
b = 2 # Second number
sum = a + b # Sum of the two numbers
print(f'The sum of {a} and {b} is {sum}')

title: Factorial using Recursion
Average of Three Numbers
code:
# This program calculates the average of three numbers
num1 = 5.5
num2 = 10.5
num3 = 20.0
average = (num1 + num2 + num3) / 3
print(f'The average of {num1}, {num2}, and {num3} is {average}')

title: Check Even or Odd
Simple Calculator
Array Initialization and Display
code:
# This program initializes a list and displays its elements
arr = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
for i in range(len(arr)):
    print(f'Element at index {i}: {arr[i]}')

title: Reverse a String
code:
# This program reverses a given string
str = 'Hello World'
reversed_str = str[::-1]
print(f'Reversed string: {reversed_str}')

title: Find Largest Element in List
code:
# This program finds the largest element in a list
arr = [10, 20, 30, 40, 50]
max_element = max(arr)
print(f'The largest element in the list is {max_element}')

title: Swap Two Numbers
code:
# This program swaps two numbers
a = 5
b = 10
print(f'Before swapping: a = {a}, b = {b}')
a, b = b, a
print(f'After swapping: a = {a}, b = {b}')

title: Check Prime Number
Fibonacci Sequence
code:
# This program prints the Fibonacci sequence up to a specified number of terms
def fibonacci(n):
    t1, t2 = 0, 1
    for _ in range(n):
        print(t1, end=' ')
        t1, t2 = t2, t1 + t2

n = 10
print(f'First {n} terms: ')
fibonacci(n)

title: Palindrome Check
code:
# This program checks if a given string is a palindrome
str = 'madam'
reversed_str = str[::-1]
if str == reversed_str:
    print(f'{str} is a palindrome')
else:
    print(f'{str} is not a palindrome')

title: Bubble Sort
Convert Celsius to Fahrenheit
code:
# This program converts a temperature from Celsius to Fahrenheit
celsius = 25.0
fahrenheit = (celsius * 9/5) + 32
print(f'Temperature in Fahrenheit: {fahrenheit}')

title: List Comprehensions
code:
# This program demonstrates the use of list comprehensions
squares = [x**2 for x in range(10)]
print('Squares:', squares)

title: Count Vowels in String
code:
# This program counts the number of vowels in a given string
vowels = 'aeiouAEIOU'
str = 'Hello World'
vowel_count = sum(1 for char in str if char in vowels)
print(f'Number of vowels in the string: {vowel_count}')

title: Merge Two Dictionaries
Find GCD of Two Numbers
code:
# This program finds the GCD of two numbers using the Euclidean algorithm
def gcd(a, b):
    while b:
        a, b = b, a % b
    return a

num1 = 54
num2 = 24
print(f'The GCD of {num1} and {num2} is {gcd(num1, num2)}')

title: Lambda Functions
code:
# This program demonstrates the use of lambda functions
add = lambda x, y: x + y
print('Sum:', add(5, 3))
